intro: Simsia scaposa, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has slender, often hairy stems and small, alternate leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
